intro: Panax cumingianus, commonly known as Cuming’s ginseng, is a rare and endangered species native to China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is closely related to other ginseng species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, and hairy roots, which are similar to those of Panax ginseng. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its rarity and medicinal potential, it is highly valued in traditional Chinese medicine.
